page.title: 01Denaby,Cadeby & High Melton
page.content: The grid area embraces an area of {contrasting characteristics.}It comprises the former pit village of {Denaby Main,}the rural villages of {Cadeby, High Melton and Old Denaby,} and parts of the towns of{Mexborough } and{Conisbrough.} It is bisected by the{River Don } alongside which runs the railway between{Doncaster}and{Sheffield.}It lies within the Doncaster Metropolitan Borough Council boundary, in the county of South Yorkshire. Whilst it has retained some of its agricultural heritage, industry has scarred part of the landscape: a pit slag heap (now reclaimed) overlooks a nature reserve at{Denaby} {Ings.}
